section.title: Windows Installer
section.p:
To install using the Windows installer, follow these steps:
Make sure that your system meets the system requirements.
Download the Windows installer.
[Optional] Validate the integrity of the downloaded file by checking it against the MD5 sum published on the download page.
Run the installer and follow the instructions in the installation program.
Start using one of the following methods:
Use one of the shortcuts created by the installer.
Run oxygen.batoxygenAuthor.batoxygenDeveloper.batoxygenJSON.batsyncroSVNClient.bat, which is located in the installation directory.
To license your copy of , go to Help Register and enter your license information.

section.title: Windows Unattended Installation
section.p: You can run the installation in unattended mode by running the installer from the command line with the -q parameter. By default, running the installer in unattended mode installs with the default options and does not overwrite existing files. You can change various options for the unattended installer using the installer command-line parameters.

section.title: Windows Installer Command-Line Reference
section.p: The installer for Windows supports a variety of command-line parameters:

dlentry.dd: Instructs the installer to run in unattended mode. The installer will not prompt the user for input during the install. Default settings will be used for all options unless a response.varfile is specified using the -varfile option.

In unattended mode, the installer does not overwrite files with the same name if a previous version of the is installed in the same folder. The -overwrite parameter added after the -q parameter forces the overwriting of these files.

Displays a console during an unattended installation.If you want the installer to run in the foreground, you need to use the start /wait command (for example, start /wait oxygen-64bit-openjdk.exe -q -console). Otherwise, it will run in the background.
Specifies the location of a response.varfile, normally to be used during an unattended installation.

Allows users to configure the installation by inputting answers to installation questions in the command line.Using this parameter is the best way to use the installer for people who are visually impaired.
This command-line parameter can be used to define any of the variables listed below to be used by an installation.

section.title: Windows Installer response.varfile
section.p: The installer for Windows also creates a file called response.varfile, which records the choices that the user made when running the installer interactively. The generated response file is found in the [OXYGEN_INSTALL_DIR]/.install4j folder. You can use the response.varfile to set the options for an unintended install. For more information about the response.varfile format, see install4j site.

dlentry.dt: Variables (can be used in the response.varfile or from the command line)

dd.p: The following variables are supported in the response.varfile (or from the command line):

dlentry.dd: Used for automatic version checking. Possible values are true (default) or false.
Used to control checking for application-related news and events. Possible values are true (default) or false.
